segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring onto the floor, forming a puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the water, yet she keeps polishing that plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s so focused on her task that she’s completely oblivious to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing on a wobbly stool, reaching for cookies, and the girl is waiting eagerly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is a disaster waiting to happen, and she’s just standing there, unfazed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets, and someone is going to slip and fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just turn off the faucet before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is the most chaotic kitchen scene I’ve ever witnessed.
segments.speaker: PAR
